36.str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.

36.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
36.str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

37.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
To accompany, follow together with. From sun and akoloutheo; to accompany.

37.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
37.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.

A dwelling; by implication, a family.

From arche and sunagoge; director of the synagogue services.

38.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
38.str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
(a) din, hubbub, confused noise, outcry, (b) riot, disturbance. From the base of throeo; a disturbance.

38.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
38.str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

38.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
38.str2: From alale; to vociferate, i.e. to wail; figuratively, to clang.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
39.str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.

39.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

39.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
39.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

39.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
39.str2: From thorubos; to be in tumult, i.e. Disturb, clamor.

39.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
39.str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

39.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

39.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.

40.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
40.str2: To laugh at, ridicule. To laugh down, i.e. Deride.

40.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

40.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

40.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
40.str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.

40.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.

Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

40.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
40.str2: To journey in(to), I go in(to), enter, intervene. From eis and poreuomai; to enter.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

41.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

41.str2: (Aramaic) arise, stand up. Of Chaldee origin; cumi.

41.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular

41.str2: To translate (from one language into another), interpret. From meta and hermeneuo; to explain over, i.e. Translate.

41.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

41.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

42.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
42.str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.

42.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
42.str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.

42.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
42.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.
Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.

42.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
42.str2: From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.
From existemi; a displacement of the mind, i.e. Bewilderment, 'ecstasy'.

43.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
43.str2: To give a commission (instructions), order; To admonish, prohibit.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

43.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
43.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

43.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
43.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

43.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
